intro: Phytocrene oblonga, commonly known as the broadleaf phytocrene, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is found in temperate regions. Its aromatic foliage contains compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Phytocrene oblonga is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
